HDG.WM.content: “in the clear night of the nothing of anxiety the original openness of beings as such arises”
HDG.WM.linkedContent: “in the clear night of the nothing of anxiety the original openness of beings as such arises”

HDG.FS.content: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, need for unity because unity never given immediately, otherwise [unity given immediately]: Schelling’s “night where all cows are black”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, need for unity because unity never given immediately, otherwise [unity given immediately]: Schelling’s “night where all cows are black”

HDG.FS.content: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)

HDG.CCP.content: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult

HDG.CCP.content: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]

HDG.CCP.content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called

HDG.LP.content: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight

HDG.LP.content: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

HDG.LP.content: night: sheltering veiling of sun’s course > [paths] walk, ienai, ier, the year [Derrida’s anniversary ring] > Das Geistliche der Jahre: der geistlich dämmernden Bläue der Nacht
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night: sheltering veiling of sun’s course > [paths] walk, ienai, ier, the year [Derrida’s anniversary ring] > Das Geistliche der Jahre: der geistlich dämmernden Bläue der Nacht

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl’s “Geistliche Dämmerung,” the waters (sometimes black, sometimes blue): show man his countenance (Antlitz), his countering glance (Gegenblick)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Geistliche Dämmerung,” the waters (sometimes black, sometimes blue): show man his countenance (Antlitz), his countering glance (Gegenblick)

HDG.LP.content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: nocturnal silence (Schweigen der Nacht), silence itself w/ its night, belongs (gehört) to apartness (Abgeschiedenheit), die Dämmerung als das Tor zum Untergang [passage], the soul’s nocturnal wing-beat (der nächtliche Flügelschlag der Seele) > [the reign of this gathering in apartness unfolds w/out delay, nicht nachträglich] > the apartness is ghostly (geistlich) > [sister of stormy sadness]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: nocturnal silence (Schweigen der Nacht), silence itself w/ its night, belongs (gehört) to apartness (Abgeschiedenheit), die Dämmerung als das Tor zum Untergang [passage], the soul’s nocturnal wing-beat (der nächtliche Flügelschlag der Seele) > [the reign of this gathering in apartness unfolds w/out delay, nicht nachträglich] > the apartness is ghostly (geistlich) > [sister of stormy sadness]

HDG.LP.content: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]
